intro: Astrantia pauciflora, commonly known as the few-flowered aster, is a herbaceous perennial native to eastern Europe and western Asia. It features basal rosettes of narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is often found in woodlands and meadows, where it contributes to the floral diversity. Astrantia pauciflora is valued in gardens for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
